name: Perphenazine Enanthate
summary: Perphenazine enanthate is a long-acting injectable typical antipsychotic used in the treatment of schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders.
description: Perphenazine enanthate is a depot formulation of the phenothiazine antipsychotic perphenazine. It is designed for intramuscular injection, providing a sustained release of the drug over time, which helps maintain consistent plasma levels and improves adherence in patients requiring long-term antipsychotic therapy. It works primarily by blocking dopamine D2 receptors in the brain, reducing symptoms of psychosis.

off_label_uses: Severe agitation in psychotic disorders (maintenance setting)

items: Maintenance therapy for chronic psychotic disorders

sections.text: Perphenazine enanthate exerts its therapeutic effect by antagonizing dopamine D2 receptors in the mesolimbic pathway, reducing hallucinations, delusions, and thought disorder. The depot formulation releases the drug slowly over weeks.

adult.Typical range: Administered every 1–4 weeks via deep intramuscular injection; dose individualized based on prior oral dosing and clinical response.

sections.geriatric: Lower initial doses recommended due to increased risk of side effects.

sections.text: Therapeutic effects begin within several days, with peak effect after steady-state is achieved over multiple doses; duration of effect is 1–4 weeks depending on dose.

sections.black_box: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis.
other: Risk of tardive dyskinesia with long-term use
Caution in patients with cardiovascular disease
Caution in patients with hepatic impairment

items: ECG for patients at risk of QT prolongation

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks; phenothiazines cross the placenta.
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; avoid or use caution.
sections.geriatrics: Greater sensitivity to sedation, orthostatic hypotension, and extrapyramidal symptoms.

sections.text: Gradual dose adjustments when discontinuing or switching to minimize withdrawal and symptom relapse.

items: Depot formulations are useful for improving adherence in patients with chronic psychotic disorders.
Requires deep intramuscular administration by a healthcare professional.
